meanings.definition: A group of singers performing together.
meanings.sent1: The chorusses sang beautifully at the concert.
meanings.sent2: The choir members formed chorusses to sing in harmony.
meanings.sent3: The chorusses in the musical wore matching outfits and sang in unison.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the chorusses filled the auditorium like a wave of music.
meanings.sent5: The audience was captivated by the powerful voices of the chorusses.

meanings.definition: The part of a song that is repeated after each verse.
meanings.sent1: After each verse, the chorusses would chime in with the catchy refrain.
meanings.sent2: The chorusses added depth to the song by repeating the chorus.
meanings.sent3: The chorusses kept forgetting the lyrics to the chorus and had to start over.
meanings.sent4: The chorus of the song echoed in the listener's mind long after the chorusses had finished singing.
meanings.sent5: The chorusses' repetition of the chorus made the song unforgettable.

meanings.definition: The act of singing in a group.
meanings.sent1: Family gatherings often involve joyful chorusses of singing around the dinner table.
meanings.sent2: The school choir practiced their chorusses for the upcoming performance.
meanings.sent3: The friends enjoyed their road trip by engaging in chorusses of their favorite songs.
meanings.sent4: The chorusses of voices blended together in perfect harmony during the community sing-along.
meanings.sent5: The tradition of holiday chorusses brought warmth and cheer to the neighborhood.
